ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.1_0: He should ask about an accusations,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.2_0: “Reverends, when you accuse this monk of an offense, in accordance with the failure in morality, or because of failure in view?”
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.4_0: “I am accused in morality because he has failed in conduct,” he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.5_0: “Do you know what failure in morality is?” “Do you know what failure in conduct is?” “Do you know what failure in view is?”
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.7_0: “I do,” he should be asked what they are.
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.12_0: “The four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen offenses entailing suspension are failure in morality,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.13_0: but an offense entailing confession for an offense entailing acknowledgment is acting a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.15_0: “Since you’re accused him of what you have seen, what you’ve heard, or what you suspect?”
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.17_0: “I’ve seen, heard, or suspected of what is heard, I suspect.” He should then say,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.18_0: “Since you see this monk, what have you seen? How did you see it? When did you see it? When did you see it? When did you see it? Where did you see it? Did you see him commit an offense entailing expulsion? Did you see him commit an offense entailing suspension? ...
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.22_0: “Where did you make an effort to do? And where does that mendicant get angry and respond?”
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.24_0: “I’m not accused that monk, but I’m accused him of what I have heard,” he should say to him,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.25_0: “Since you have heard this monk, what have you heard? When did you heard? When did you hear it from you see it? When did you heard it? Where did you see it? ...
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.30_0: Did you hear it from a monk? Did you hear it from a nun? Did you hear it from a trainee nun? Did you hear it from a novice monk? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from the ascetics of another religion? Did you hear it from the lay followers of another religion? Did you hear it from the lay followers of another religion?’
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.32_0: “I’m not accused that monk, but because he has heard that he has heard, I say to him,
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.33_0: “Since you suspect that you’re suspected, what do you suspect? How do you suspect that, when did you suspect it? When did you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Where did you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it? Do you suspect it is a serious offense entailing suspension?
ai-pli-tv-pvr13:1.37_0: Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a trainee nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a male lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a female lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from kings? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a king’s officials? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from the ascetics of another religion?”
